channel.title: Nationalism-IAT on Project Implicit's International Sites
channel.description: Recent content in Nationalism-IAT on Project Implicit's International Sites

item.title: Analysis of Israel's data
item.author: mayanna@post.bgu.ac.il (Project Implicit)
item.description: body, td { font-size: 16px; } code.r{ font-size: 12px; } pre { font-size: 12px } .main-container { max-width: 1750px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; } Summary Across all IAT tasks, both deliberate and automatic evaluation measures point to a preference of the dominant category over the non-dominant category. Across all tasks, the bias (preference) was much larger for the automatic than the deliberate evaluation. Across most of the tasks, the bias stays the same across the 12 years of data collection.
